intro: Lasiandra mucorifera, commonly known as the mucorifera lasiandra, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a shrub-like appearance with small, leathery leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are clustered in inflorescences. Lasiandra mucorifera is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to tolerate salt spray and coastal conditions.
